intro: Arabidium alpestre, commonly known as the alpine Arabidium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or alpine soils at high elevations. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
